Do you need to use only one function from a package, but feel like you need to load the package to have it available? There's better ways!
 
You can use the :: notation to load it in as below.
![](images/molr_jan24_2022.png)

Or you can use `library(<library_name>, include.only = <function>)` with R 3.6 and later.
![](images/molr_jan24_2022(2).png)

Happy coding!

<https://www.roelpeters.be/load-single-function-r-library/>
